body:
I was successfully able to get a cluster to start up in us-west-2, the default region for kube-up, but for some reason I'm not successfully able to start up a cluster in us-east-1.

I'm not seeing anything in the logs that seems to be a huge problem, so I'm not really sure how to resolve this.

Kubelet log here:

```
server.go:236] Using root directory: /var/lib/kubelet
manager.go:113] cAdvisor running in container: "/"
fs.go:87] Filesystem partitions: map[/dev/disk/by-uuid/5ecf1d67-1075-4dcc-bd94-0d4e17df997b:{mountpoint:/ major:202 minor:1}]
manager.go:134] Machine: {NumCores:2 CpuFrequency:2900098 MemoryCapacity:3946876928 MachineID:19b6e48dcced68b7e31ea64054cf9625 SystemUUID:EC245D6C-4926-B64C-790D-351D952F7CEA BootID:5dd71066-9db0-4200-8332-bbed54bf0e14 Filesystems:[{Device:/dev/disk/by-uuid/5ecf1d67-1075-4dcc-bd94-0d4e17df997b Capacity:8309932032}] DiskMap:map[252:0:{Name:dm-0 Major:252 Minor:0 Size:107374182400 Scheduler:none} 252:1:{Name:dm-1 Major:252 Minor:1 Size:10737418240 Scheduler:none} 202:0:{Name:xvda Major:202 Minor:0 Size:8589934592 Scheduler:deadline}] NetworkDevices:[{Name:cbr0 MacAddress:d2:72:92:85:25:b8 Speed:0 Mtu:1460} {Name:eth0 MacAddress:0e:34:0b:ac:ce:17 Speed:10000 Mtu:9001}] Topology:[{Id:0 Memory:3946876928 Cores:[{Id:0 Threads:[0 1] Caches:[{Size:32768 Type:Data Level:1} {Size:32768 Type:Instruction Level:1} {Size:262144 Type:Unified Level:2}]}] Caches:[{Size:26214400 Type:Unified Level:3}]}]}
manager.go:141] Version: {KernelVersion:3.16.0-30-generic ContainerOsVersion:Ubuntu 14.10 DockerVersion:1.6.0 CadvisorVersion:0.13.0}
factory.go:228] Registering Docker factory
factory.go:64] Registering Raw factory
manager.go:897] Started watching for new ooms in manager
oomparser.go:199] OOM parser using kernel log file: "/var/log/kern.log"
manager.go:219] Starting recovery of all containers
manager.go:224] Recovery completed
plugins.go:69] No cloud provider specified.
server.go:251] Successfully initialized cloud provider: "" from the config file: ""
server.go:264] Using self-signed cert (/var/run/kubernetes/kubelet.crt, /var/run/kubernetes/kubelet.key)
docker.go:258] Connecting to docker on unix:///var/run/docker.sock
server.go:452] No api server defined - no events will be sent to API server.
plugins.go:56] Registering credential provider: .dockercfg
server.go:477] Started kubelet
kubelet.go:600] No api server defined - no node status update will be sent.
server.go:63] Starting to listen on 0.0.0.0:10250
event.go:203] Event(api.ObjectReference{Kind:"Node", Namespace:"", Name:"ip-172-20-0-9", UID:"ip-172-20-0-9", APIVersion:"", ResourceVersion:"", FieldPath:""}): reason: 'starting' Starting kubelet.
kubelet.go:609] Running in container "/kubelet"
status_manager.go:56] Starting to sync pod status with apiserver
kubelet.go:1326] Starting kubelet main sync loop.
kubelet.go:1281] error getting node: node ip-172-20-0-9 not found
kubelet.go:1281] error getting node: node ip-172-20-0-9 not found
kubelet.go:1281] error getting node: node ip-172-20-0-9 not found
kubelet.go:1281] error getting node: node ip-172-20-0-9 not found
kubelet.go:1281] error getting node: node ip-172-20-0-9 not found
kubelet.go:1281] error getting node: node ip-172-20-0-9 not found
```

I'm not really sure what else to look at, I'm happy to do more investigation, but not really sure where to look. Most others log files are empty with the exception of kube-addons.log which is failing to start addons due to the unstarted api server.

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Cluster Lifecycle.
labels.name: sig/cluster-lifecycle

title: AWS: Cannot kube-up in us-east-1 region.
